DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque1: Cette étrange et ancienne plaque métallique a été découverte dans la rivière d'un bois à côté du village.
DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque2: Ses origines sont inconnues : elles ne sont clairement ni nomaï, ni atriennes. Y aurait-il eu une autre civilisation sur Âtrebois par le passé ? Hélas, ceci est l'unique vestige que nous avons pu retrouver de cette civilisation.
DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque3: Les gravures de la plaque représentent notre système solaire, et ce qui semble être le système le plus proche, Proximâtre. Se pourrait-il qu'elle vienne de si loin ?
DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque4: Nous avons longtemps cru ne jamais connaître la réponse, mais grâce aux générateurs de distorsion embarqués dans les nouvelles fusées du programme Odyssée, ce mystère pourrait bientôt être résolu !
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod1: [Ça ne fait aucun doute, la plaque du musée vient de cette sorte d'habitacle ! Elle en a été arrachée, mais il s'agit du même métal et de la même peinture.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod2: [A en juger la structure, ça ressemble à une capsule de sauvetage. Elle a l'air en bon état, son ou ses occupants ont de toute évidence survécu au crash.]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod3: [Peut-être qu'un jour, nous découvrirons ce qu'il est advenu des survivants ? Cela remonte à très longtemps, mais, il doit bien y avoir une chance.]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod4: [Félicitations ! Vous avez terminé la version de Proximâtre (Hearth's Neighbor) telle que soumise lors de la jam d'été 2023 (à moins que vous n'ayez trouvé cette capsule avant !). Nous avions bien d'autres plans pour la suite, mais la date butoir nous a contraint à y couper court.]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod5: [Peut-être qu'un jour, nous réviserons complètement ce mod, et lui offrirons une véritable fin, mais nous ne pouvons rien promettre.]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod7: [Quoi, vous en voulez encore ? Très bien. Retournez là où vous avez appris l'existence de cette capsule, et cherchez un tunnel secret. Une de ses entrées est visible, mais bloquée. Cependant, le chemin continue bien jusque l'autre côté... essayez donc d'en retrouver l'accès.]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevShoe1: c moi l'shossonnier, j'avais un peu la flemme en modélisant blblblbl
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevShoe2: [Shoe:Modélisateur 3D, quand il n'était pas "occupé" à jouer à Terraria, Minecraft, ou Quantum Space Buddies]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine1: Coucou, moi c'est Lumine, une artiste du mod ! Malgré pas mal de problèmes, j'ai quand même fait de mon mieux, et j'espère que vous apprécierez tous notre travail.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine2: Nous aurions voulu inclure bien plus d'illustrations dans le mod, mais à cause de mes problèmes et de la date butoir, je n'ai pas pu les faire.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine3: Même si l'histoire est courte, peut-être que je pourrai la poursuivre à l'occasion d'autres jams.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine4: Ce fut un plaisir de participer à ma toute première jam, j'espère que vous avez aimé jouer à ce mod !
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm1: Salut ! Je suis GameWyrm, le chef d'équipe et level designer. J'ai aussi fait tous les modèles pourris de ce mod.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm2: J'espère que vous avez aimé Proximâtre (Hearth's Neighbor) ! Je parie que ce n'est pas l'entrée la plus complexe ou raffinée de cette jam, mais j'aspire à ce que vous ayez pris un peu de plaisir à y jouer.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm3: Nous avions une histoire et une fin bien plus complexes en tête, mais à cause de la date butoir, nous avons dû revoir nos plans à la baisse.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm4: Mon but était de créer quelque chose de différent de la plupart des mods histoire : j'ai explicitement voulu éviter d'inclure des Nomaï ou des Érangers (pardon, xen, des habitants de l'Étranger]]>). C'était sans doute une mauvaise idée, vu que ça a réduit le nombre d'assets du jeu de base que nous avions à disposition, et nous a empêché d'utiliser du texte pour communiquer au joueur, mais j'espère que les mystères auréolant cette nouvelle race compensent les défauts de l'histoire.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame1: Yo ! Je m'appelle EndgameZero, le compositeur de Proximâtre (Hearth's Neighbor).
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame2: Je me suis bien amusé à composer la musique pour ce mod, et j'espère vous l'avez appréciée.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame3: J'ai tout particulièrement aimé composer les morceaux qui reprennent les thèmes du jeu de base (The River au tempo 5/4 étant ma préférée) et cacher des secrets (vous entendez, là maintenant ?).
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame4: Sachez que c'est ma première participation à une jam (et à un mod de manière générale) : je ne connais pas bien la chanson, mais je suis honoré d'en faire partie.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc1: Le ponton utilisé dans le Noyau Lacustre a été fait par Shoe avant cette jam, pour un autre mod.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc2: Quelques effets sonores proviennent de FreeSounds, réalisés par smokinghotdog.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc3: Nous remercions particulièrement John Corby, Triffid, xen, et Idiot du serveur Discord de modding d'Outer Wilds pour leurs réponses aux nombreux questions que nous nous sommes posées pendant le développement.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc4: Merci également à l'équipe du mod New Horizons. Sans eux, nous n'aurions jamais pu achever ce mod dans la limite du temps imparti.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc5: Traduction française par Luke Hakurei. Traduction russe par Metrocop12.

ShipLogDictionary.$HNACDescription: Sous le désert arctique, j'ai découvert un étrange territoire d'îles flottantes enneigées. Leur traversée va mettre mes compétences de vol à l'épreuve, notamment ne pas oublier que je peux m'envoler plus haut si j'utilise mes propulseurs immédiatement après avoir sauté, pour profiter du momentum ascendant.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACRedHouse: Sur l'île la plus grande, j'ai découvert un bâtiment, qui semble être la demeure originelle des habitants de cette planète.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACRedMural: Dans la maison, j'ai vu une curieuse peinture murale représentant un autochtone rouge qui parvient à créer trois dimensions de poches au sein de Lascète.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACCode: Une sorte de code était inscrit sur une table.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACSecretInfo: Une maison se trouve sur une île très isolée du Noyau Alpin.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACSecretMap: La maison contient une carte du ciel comportant les systèmes proches, y compris le nôtre. Les autochtones avaient l'air intéressés par une étrange anomalie à la bordure de notre système, mais il semble y avoir eu désaccord à propos du trajet pour y parvenir, ou juste de s'il fallait y aller ou non.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSAlpineRumor: On the Alpine Core, I found a code of some kind.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSLakeRumor: At the Lake Shrine, I found evidence that the blue inhabitants built a large space ship.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSDeadLakeRumor: At the satellite dish behind the big door at the Dead Lake, I detected a signal coming from space. It seems to be some kind of distress signal.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSLavaRumor: At the Lava Shrine, I found a mural depicting a large ship that the inhabitants built.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSEntry: A lifeless ship hovers at the edge of the solar system.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSBarrier: The entrance to the ship is blocked by a barrier. A panel is nearby that accepts a five-digit code.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSInfo: The ship is filled with Ghost Matter. There is still minimal power, but the engines do not seem to function.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSCryo: There is a room filled with cryogenic sleeping pods. However, every inhabitant within them has died long ago.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSCockpit: I found a way into the cockpit.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSDamage: On the screens in the cockpit, I saw some kind of damage report. The red inhabitants invaded the ship and tried to take over, but the blue inhabitants who were awake fought back. The leader of the reds tried to fight the leader of the blues, but was defeated. In a final act of defiance, the red leader activated a ghost matter bomb that killed everyone on-board and immobolized the ship.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSHope: One screen displayed that one of the escape pods had managed to successfully launch. It landed on Timber Hearth. The ship then began opening communications with the pod, revealing a signal frequency.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKDescription: Below the Dead Lake, there is a strange sea dotted with a few islands. Next to the elevator that took me down is a levitating radio dish pointing north.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKRaft: There is a raft on the starting island. Its controls appear to react to light.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineRumor: North of the starting island, there is a shrine of some kind on elevated ground. The stairs to the shrine have long crumbled.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineEntry: The shrine has a secret entrance via a tunnel in the water.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNKLKShrineStation: There seems to be some kind of makeshift communications station in the shrine. There is a lever and a levitating radio dish pointing towards the entrance.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineLever: The lever opened a door in the hangar at the Dead Lake.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineMural: There is a mural in the shrine recounting a war between two factions, conveyed with red against blue inhabitants. This war lead to most of the planet becoming uninhabitable. Seeing this, the leaders of the two factions agreed to a truce and began to rebuild.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrinePoster: A poster above the communications area displays blue inhabitants flying ships into space and slowly building a much larger ship.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKMazeInfo: South of the starting island, there is a large landmass. It contains a tunnel.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKMazeGazebo: After going through the tunnel, I emerged at the surface. There is a gazebo with a mural on it. The mural seems to point out a tunnel below the water under a shrine.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVDescription: Below the Extinct Volcano, there is a cracked sphere with lava rising and falling.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtons: This core contains structures locked by various buttons. They are very easy to press, not requiring very much pressure to activate, but must all be activated simultaneously.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVSignal: A dish at the entrance to the core is sending and receiving communications from various structures on the core.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVFirstButtonInfo: I found a locked structure with a button right outside of it. I don't see a second one, could it have fallen into the lava?
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVSecondButtonInfo: I found a locked structure with two pillars nearby sticking out of the lava.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVThirdButtonInfo: I found a series of locked structures.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineInfo: Near the entrance to the lava core exists a very large building. It is not made of metal like the other structures nearby. A barrier prevents entry.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineInfoAlt: A shrine can be found a short distance from the entrance to the lava core. A barrier blocks entry, but activating three buttons across the core opens it.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtonOne: I found a button at the Structure on a Cliff.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtonTwo: I found a button at the Structure by Pillars.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtonThree: I found a button at the Old Abandoned Town.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineEntry: When I entered the shrine, I fell through a fake floor! It turns out that the inhabitants have walls that appear to exist, but are not at all solid. The only way to tell that wall is fake is a symbol on it, which could be <![CDATA[<color=orange>hidden in plain sight</color>]]>.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineMurals: At the end of the shrine, I found four murals. The first three seem to depict several planets becoming increasingly unstable and falling apart. The fourth depicts a group flying away in a ship, while another group is saddened and angered at being left behind.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHArrival: I've arrived in Hearth's Neighbor. The only immediately obvious feature in this system is a lone, dusty planet.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHInfo: Hearth's Neighbor's sole planet. The surface is devoid of life.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHElevator: I found some kind of elevator that went below the surface and emerged in a strange expansive area. Is this planet <![CDATA[<color=orange>bigger on the inside</color>]]>?
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHPlantRumor: There is a strange domed structure on the surface of Lonely Hermit.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHPlantNoEntry: There does not seem to be a way inside. Judging by the copious amounts of Ghost Matter leaking out of it, it may not be a good idea to go inside it regardless.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHPlantInfo: A mural indicates that this structure is built around a comet that once crashed into the planet. The planet's inhabitants harnessed a power from within the comet to fuel their civilization.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHWastelandRumor: There appears to be some snow-covered mountains at the north pole.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHWastelandRumorAlt: At the north pole, there are small remnants of civilization.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHWastelandElevator: I found a functioning elevator in the wasteland.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHVolcanoRumor: There appears to be a tall, hollow mountain close to the south pole.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHVolcanoRumorAlt: A long-extinct volcano exists on the surface.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHVolcanoElevator: I found a functioning elevator on a structure within the caldera of the volcano.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeRumor: There is a large structure surrounded by a moat.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeRumorAlt: A strange structure exists surrounded by a moat. Despite the water, the area does not have any signs of life.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeElevator: I found a functioning elevator within the structure.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeHangar: The structure has some kind of landing/launching pad for larger ships. The pad is connected to a large hangar of some kind where the inhabitants of this planet stored resources to build a much larger structure.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeDoorRumor: There is a massive locked door in the hangar.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeDoorSatellite: Behind the door was a floating satellite pointing at something in space. There is a signal coming out of it.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateIntro: The museum has restored an old exhibit that's been in storage for a while. It can be found behind the stairs.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateIntroAlt: The museum has an alien plate on display. While it doesn't seem to be Nomai in origin, its creator is unknown.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateDetails: The plate has a map of two solar systems carved on it. One is our system, but the other is a nearby system, Hearth's Neighbor. With a warp drive in one's ship, one could warp to that system and check it out.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateResolution: The plate was left by the sole survivor of Hearth's Neighbor's inhabitants. They had crashed onto our planet and lived here until the end of their days.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNPodRumor: The damage report from the Derelict Ship showed an escape pod land on Timber Hearth. A signal from the ship connected to it.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNPodResolution: The pod is intact! Whoever landed here survived, though what happened to them is a mystery lost to time. The plate at the museum came from the hull of the pod, likely carved out by the survivor(s) wanting to leave a message of where they came from.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNPodThanks: You have finished the Jam version of Hearth's Neighbor! Congrats! Of course, there may still be a few secrets remaining...
